name: JavaScript
description: A high-level, interpreted programming language

name: Variables
description: Containers for storing data values.

name: Functions
description: Blocks of code that can be called and executed.

name: Arrays
description: Variables that can hold multiple values.

name: Objects
description: Complex data structures with properties and methods.

name: DOM Manipulation
description: Interacting with the Document Object Model of a web page.

name: Node.js
description: A runtime environment that allows running JavaScript code outside of a web browser

name: React
description: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces, developed by Facebook

name: D3.js
description: A JavaScript library for creating interactive data visualizations in the browser

name: TypeScript
description: A superset of JavaScript that adds static typing to the language

name: AJAX
description: Asynchronous JavaScript and XML, a technique used for creating interactive web applications

name: Webpack
description: A module bundler for JavaScript applications, helps manage dependencies and assets

name: ES6
description: ECMAScript 2015, a major update to the JavaScript language with new features and syntax

name: WebAssembly
description: A binary instruction format for a stack-based virtual machine, used as a compilation target for programming languages

name: Local Variables
description: Variables that are declared inside a function and have local scope.

name: Global Variables
description: Variables that are declared outside of any function and have global scope.

name: Recursive Functions
description: Functions that call themselves either directly or indirectly in order to solve a problem.

name: Anonymous Functions
description: Functions that are declared without a name and are often used as arguments to other functions.

name: Variable Functions
description: Variable functions are dynamic functions that can operate on variables directly, allowing for flexible data manipulation and processing.

name: Function Variables
description: Function variables refer to the ability to store functions in variables, enabling higher-order programming and functional programming paradigms.
